featured.text: Wearing a bindi has become more of a fashion statement than a religious custom.
Decorative or sticker bindis come in all sizes, colors and variations, and can be worn by young and old, married and unmarried people alike.
The dot goes by different names in different Hindi dialects, and “bindi” is the one that is most commonly known.
The word “bindi” means “red” in some Hindi dialects.
The position of the bindi is standard: center of the forehead, close to the eyebrows.

other.text: Why was red chosen as the original color of the bindi?
Most Indian women do not like to wear bindis anymore.
Which of the following statements is true about the practice of wearing a bindi today?

definition.zh_def: 在印度文化中，貼在額頭上的小圓點，通常用於裝飾或象徵宗教意義。
definition.en_def: A decorative dot worn on the forehead, often associated with Indian culture and religion.
definition.example: She wore a beautiful bindi that complemented her traditional outfit.
